definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to misplace/displacement (e.g. of broken bones)/out of alignment/faulty contact/erroneous judgment/inversion (medical, e.g. breach delivery)
to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to admit an error/to acknowledge one's mistake
a misjudged legal case/a miscarriage (of justice)

sentences.english: Sheldon: You know, I think I may have misjudged this restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我想我給這家餐廳的評價錯了。

sentences.english: You don't have to do something to make me feel so sad.
sentences.chinese: 你不一定要做錯什麼事情才讓我如此傷心難過。

sentences.english: Zhu Geliang chopped and cut, are wrong.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮斬與不斬，都是錯。

sentences.english: She thinks I'm going out with Jeremy but she's completely on the wrong tack .
sentences.chinese: 她認爲我準備同傑里米外出，但是她的想法完全錯了。

sentences.english: This has now almost entirely vanished - and it is not entirely the fault of the men.
sentences.chinese: 這種情況現在已經完全消失了，而且錯不完全在男方。

sentences.english: Is this Shunting Yard's fault or my own?
sentences.chinese: 這是調車場的錯還是我自己？

sentences.english: We know you’ll be sure to tell us what you think we’ve gotten right and -- more likely -- wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定你知道什麼是對什麼是錯。

sentences.english: You thought your victory was inevitable, but you were wrong.
sentences.chinese: 你以爲你的勝利手到擒來，但是你錯了。

sentences.english: To call by an incorrect name; misname.
sentences.chinese: 狗並不知道如果你叫它叫錯名字。

sentences.english: Even then, Mr Blanchard might be wrong. He may be understating the costs of higher inflation.
sentences.chinese: 即使是這樣，布蘭查德可能也是錯的。

sentences.english: But it has proven to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但是，事實證明這是錯的。

sentences.english: What? I did know you'd guess wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我就知道你一定會猜錯的。

sentences.english: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
sentences.chinese: 患難時倚靠不忠誠的人，好像破壞的牙，錯骨縫的腳。

sentences.english: I mistook the stick for a snake.
sentences.chinese: 我把那根棒子錯看成蛇了。

sentences.english: The police are off beam in their search for the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 警察搜尋罪犯時方向錯了。

sentences.english: If he just wanted the rod, then he would get none of the fish.
sentences.chinese: 錯了，他如果只要釣竿，那他一條魚也喫不到。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
